name: Hikma Health Inc
mission: We partner with nonprofit organizations providing healthcare in underserved and refugee populations. We create customized data systems for these healthc...
theoryOfChange: Hikma Health utilizes an 'implementation science framework' to understand the real-world application of its system. Their 'Our Approach' section details how they empower individuals with health data, offer clinicians data-driven tools, and enable clinic managers to anticipate needs and plan logistics. The 'Health and Environmental Record System (HERS)' page presents a flowchart that visually explains how their integrated EHR system collects environmental data, combines it with health records to identify at-risk patients, and produces results for targeted care, public health planning, and policy decisions at individual, health system, and government levels. This flowchart serves as a logic model, illustrating the causal pathways from their system's activities to desired outcomes.

evaluationSources: Grand Prize, 22nd Annual New Ventures Competition (Harvard Business School)

zakatClaimEvidence: Hikma Health's donation page and 'About Us' sections do not explicitly mention accepting zakat donations or having dedicated zakat funds or campaigns. (Source: https://www.hikmahealth.com/donate)

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization addresses the urgent cause of global health for displaced populations, which aligns well with the values of sadaqah-motivated donors [3]. Its focus on underserved communities provides a medium donor fit for those seeking to support technology-driven health equity [1].
dimension_explanations.impact: Hikma Health focuses on systemic change by providing the digital infrastructure necessary for healthcare in low-resource settings, such as Latin America [1]. While its program expense ratio is 100.0%, the direct cost per beneficiary is not currently available, leading to a balanced impact rating [2].

strengths_deep_dive: Hikma Health's primary strength lies in its ability to deliver <cite id="4">systemic change through implementation science research</cite> and EHR deployment without the overhead typical of larger NGOs. Their <cite id="1">perfect program expense ratio</cite> is a rare benchmark in the nonprofit sector, particularly for technology-focused entities. Furthermore, the organization has achieved a <cite id="5">Silver Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>, indicating a commitment to sharing organizational metrics and governance details. Their focus on <cite id="4">underserved and refugee populations</cite> aligns with high-urgency global health needs, providing a specialized niche for donors interested in the intersection of technology and humanitarian aid.
rich_narrative.summary: Hikma Health Inc. is a specialized technology nonprofit that empowers healthcare providers serving refugee and underserved populations through <cite id="1">customized, open-source data systems</cite>. By developing tools like the Health and Environmental Record System (HERS), the organization addresses critical data gaps in global health, particularly for displaced communities in regions such as <cite id="4">Nicaragua</cite>. The organization operates on a lean financial model, reporting <cite id="2">total revenue of $70,494</cite> in the 2023 tax year. Remarkably, Hikma Health maintains a <cite id="1">100.0% program expense ratio</cite>, ensuring that every dollar of reported spending is directed toward its core mission of health data innovation. This high efficiency is further evidenced by a <cite id="1">fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised</cite>, indicating that the organization does not utilize traditional paid fundraising channels to sustain its operations. While the organization is small in scale, it demonstrates significant financial stability with <cite id="1">26.0 months of working capital</cite> held in working capital, providing a robust runway for its systemic change initiatives.
